Package org.jtrim2.event.track

Class TrackedEvent<ArgType>

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.event.track.TrackedEvent<ArgType>
Type Parameters:
ArgType - the type of the event argument
public final class TrackedEvent<ArgType> extends Object
Defines an event and its causing events. This class was designed for EventTracker implementations to be able to dispatch an event with its causes.

Thread safety

The methods of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently. In case the event argument and the arguments of the causes are immutable (and they are recommended to be immutable), instances of this class are immutable as well.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
See Also:

  • TrackedEventListener
  • TrackedListenerManager

  • Field Details

    • NO_CAUSE

      public static final EventCauses NO_CAUSE
      An EventCauses instance defining an empty cause list. That is, its getNumberOfCauses() method always returns zero. This instance is completely immutable.

  • Constructor Details

    • TrackedEvent

      public TrackedEvent(ArgType eventArg)
      Creates a TrackedEvent with no causes. Invoking this constructor as passing NO_CAUSE for the causes.
      Parameters:
      eventArg - the event argument of the event occurred. This argument can be null if the event allows null arguments.

    • TrackedEvent

      public TrackedEvent(EventCauses causes, ArgType eventArg)
      Creates a TrackedEvent with the given causes and argument.
      Parameters:
      causes - the causes of the event. This argument cannot be null.
      eventArg - the event argument of the event occurred. This argument can be null if the event allows null arguments.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the causes argument is null

  • Method Details

    • getCauses

      public EventCauses getCauses()
      Returns the causes of the event which was specified at construction time.
      Returns:
      the causes of the event which was specified at construction time. This method never returns null.

    • getEventArg

      public ArgType getEventArg()
      Returns the event argument which describes the event occurred. This is the same object as the one specified at construction time.

      The event argument is intended to further describe a specific kind of event. For example: for mouse click events, this can be a coordinate. Note that the event argument can only be interpreted if the kind of event occurred is also known.

      Returns:
      the event argument which describes the event occurred. This method may return null if null was specified at construction time.
